title: Why don't you get a headache when someone hits your head?

title: Why are some people afraid of dogs?

title: What's the best way to get a good price on an apartment?

I don't want to spend more than $1500 a month, but most of the apartments we have looked at are closer to $2000.   We both work full-time jobs, so money isn't really an issue. But still, I feel like we should be able to find something cheaper. Any tips or advice would be greatly appreciated!

title: Is there a way to make an online form without javascript?

Are there any alternatives or ways to make an online form that does not require using Javascript?

title: What is a “pudding” in the UK?
self_text: I’m not talking about chocolate pudding or vanilla pudding. The term seems to be used for different things and I can’t get a straight answer.  I’ve heard it means Yorkshire pudding, which looks like a savoury pancake/popover but I thought that was just a special kind of pudding made for Christmas Dinner, rather than all puddings being like that. I’ve also seen people referring to custard as pudding.  What’s going on here?!

title: Is it possible to get a job as an animal caretaker in the USA without having any prior experience?

I do however have a lot of pets myself, including two cats, three birds and a fish tank. Would they count towards experience?

title: Why do people give birth to a kid?

title: Is it true that the average white American is about 5’9” tall?

Is there any good source of information out there that can help me figure out what the average height of an American actually is?

title: How does the US government deal with foreign interference in elections?
self_text: I was talking to a friend about what happened in 2016, and how Russia interfered in the election. They said that they didn't think it mattered because "the US government is so powerful, they can just block any Russian hackers."  I told them that wasn't true, but I don't really know exactly *how* the US government deals with this stuff. Is there a special department or agency responsible for investigating and responding to foreign interference? What kind of things do they do? Do they have the ability to shut down websites or social media accounts used by foreign actors?  What about companies like Facebook and Google? Do they have any responsibility for preventing their platforms from being used to spread disinformation?

title: Why is it that some people who are on a diet have no problem with eating cheat meals, but others feel like they ruined their progress if they eat even something as small as an extra biscuit?
self_text: I'm not sure how to phrase this question so it doesn't come off as rude or accusatory, but I've been noticing something for years now when someone asks me what my body fat percentage is. Most of the time they get disappointed when I say I'm at around 20%, and then go on about how much easier it would be to lose weight if I had abs or other visible muscle definition. This really bothers me because it implies that I should somehow be ashamed of my body, especially since there's nothing wrong with being in good health without having a six pack. I also see people constantly posting pictures of themselves working out on social media, which just makes me feel worse about myself. Is it possible that some people only care about appearance, and don't actually care about improving their health? Or am I just overthinking things?

title: Why are people so quick to say that a movie is boring?
self_text: I don't think movies are inherently boring, they just aren't for you.  I also think there should be some nuance when you watch something and dislike it, like maybe it wasn't the right time or place to view it.

title: Is it okay to eat the white part of a banana?
self_text: I've always eaten bananas without peeling them, but recently my friend told me that the white part is poisonous and I should avoid eating it. I did some research online, but I couldn't find any information about this. Is there any truth to what my friend said?

title: Is it okay to take a shower without washing your hair?
self_text: I do it sometimes but I always feel gross after the fact even if I don’t have oily skin, what are your thoughts?
